title: The wall-flower as it grew out of the stone-chamber belonging to the metropolitan prison of London called Newgate : being a history which is partly true, partly romantick, morally divine : whereby a marriage between reality and fancy is solemnized by divinity / written by Thomas Bayly ... whilst he was prisoner there.
author: Bayly, Thomas, d. 1657?
publisher: Printed by J.G. and are to be sold by Peter Parker ...,
notes: "A reissue, with cancel t.p., of the first edition, published in 1650 under title: Herba parietis, or, The wall flower"--NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
